meanings.definition: To put new laces on (a shoe or other item).
meanings.sent1: I need to relace my sneakers before going for a run.
meanings.sent2: She decided to relace her boots to make them look new again.
meanings.sent3: After tripping on his untied shoelaces, he realized it was time to relace them.
meanings.sent4: The old baseball glove was relaced with fresh laces, ready for another season.
meanings.sent5: The hiker had to relace his hiking boots to ensure a secure fit on the rocky trail.

meanings.definition: To repair or strengthen (a structure) by adding new lacing.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter had to relace the chair to make it sturdy again.
meanings.sent2: The bridge was relaced with stronger cables to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent3: The old swing set was relaced to ensure it could withstand the children's play.
meanings.sent4: The tent was relaced with extra ropes to withstand the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: To relace the hammock, he used a thicker material for added durability.

meanings.definition: To replace or renew laces on (a piece of clothing or equipment).
meanings.sent1: She had to relace her corset before the event to match her dress.
meanings.sent2: The athlete needed to relace his cleats for better performance on the field.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would relace his apron with gold laces for a fancy look.
meanings.sent4: The old backpack was relaced with reflective laces for safety during night walks.
meanings.sent5: To relace the hoodie, she chose neon green laces for a pop of color.
